title: Neil Mustoe
text:
Neil John Mustoe (born 5 November 1976) is an English former <a href="association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a>. He last played for <a href="Conference%20North">Conference North</a> side <a href="Gloucester%20City%20A.F.C.">Gloucester City</a>. He first signed for City at the start of the 2002–03 season but left in January 2003 to join <a href="Stevenage%20F.C.">Stevenage Borough</a>, and soon afterwards, <a href="Yeovil%20Town%20F.C.">Yeovil Town</a>. He re-signed for the club in August 2003.
Born in <a href="Gloucester">Gloucester</a>, Mustoe signed for <a href="Manchester%20United%20F.C.">Manchester United</a> on leaving school in 1993 and subsequently earned Schoolboy International honours. He won the <a href="FA%20Youth%20Cup">FA Youth Cup</a> in 1995 while at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>, and became a professional soon afterwards, but <a href="Alex%20Ferguson">Alex Ferguson</a> never selected him for a first-team game and he joined <a href="Wigan%20Athletic%20F.C.">Wigan Athletic</a> in December 1997, later turning out for <a href="Cambridge%20United%20F.C.">Cambridge United</a> for four seasons, but was released in summer 2002 as part of cost-cutting measures following the <a href="ITV%20Digital">ITV Digital</a> collapse.
He became joint-caretaker manager of non-league Gloucester City, with <a href="Adie%20Harris">Adie Harris</a>, on 5 January 2006 following the resignation of <a href="Chris%20Burns%20%28football%29">Chris Burns</a> until the appointment of Tim Harris from <a href="Merthyr%20Tydfil%20F.C.">Merthyr Tydfil</a> on 11 January 2006.
Mustoe captained his home town club to win the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern Football League</a> play offs with a 1–0 win over <a href="Farnborough%20Town">Farnborough Town</a> to earn promotion to the <a href="Conference%20North">Conference North</a> in May 2009.
For the 2010–11 season Mustoe was appointed first team coach, a position he held in addition to his playing duties.
On 21st December 2021, Neil was announced as interim manager of <a href="Hellenic%20Football%20League">Hellenic League</a> side <a href="Tuffley%20Rovers%20F.C.">Tuffley Rovers</a>.
